titleInfo.title: Letter, Henry Cherry in Knoxville, Tenn. to Amos Gould in Owosso, Mich., 1864 July 11

mods.abstract: In this letter, dated July 11, 1864, Henry Cherry writes from Knoxville, Tenn. to Amos Gould, in Owosso, Michigan, thanking him for his help in clearing up the problems with Cherry's certificate of muster. He also discusses how happy the officers were to receive the paperwork that would allow Cherry to be paid. Finally, Cherry discusses delivering Sunday services to people in the "country" noting that "The people from every direction are urging me to come & preach, but my duties will not permit me to be often absent from camp."

subject.topic: United States. Army. Michigan Cavalry Regiment, 10th (1861-1865).
